definitions.definition: a mark, object, or figure formed by two short intersecting lines or pieces (+ or ×).
examples: cut a cross in the bark with a sharp knife

definitions.definition: a cross (×) used to show that something is incorrect or unsatisfactory.
an upright post with a transverse bar, as used in antiquity for crucifixion.
examples: crucifix, rood a bronze cross

definitions.definition: the cross on which Jesus was crucified.
examples: noun: Cross; plural noun: the Cross

definitions.definition: this, or a representation of it, as an emblem of Christianity.
examples: she wore a cross around her neck

definitions.definition: a thing that is unavoidable and has to be endured.
examples: she's just a cross we have to bear
synonyms: headache "we all have our crosses to bear"

definitions.definition: short for sign of the cross (see sign).
a staff surmounted by a cross carried in religious processions.
a cross-shaped decoration awarded for personal valor or indicating rank in some orders of knighthood.
examples: the Military Cross

definitions.definition: the constellation Southern Cross.
examples: plural noun: the Cross

definitions.definition: an animal or plant resulting from crossbreeding; a hybrid.
examples: a Devon and Holstein cross
synonyms: combination "a cross between a yak and a cow"

definitions.definition: a mixture or compromise of two things.
examples: noun: a cross between

definitions.definition: a sideways or transverse movement or pass, in particular.
a pass of the ball across the field toward the center close to one's opponents' goal.
a blow delivered across and over the opponent's lead.
examples: a right cross

definitions.definition: go or extend across or to the other side of (a path, road, stretch of water, or area).
examples: he has crossed the Atlantic twice
synonyms: cover "they crossed the hills on foot"span
pass over "a lake crossed by a fine stone bridge"

definitions.definition: go across or climb over (an obstacle or boundary).
examples: he attempted to cross the border into Jordan

definitions.definition: (especially of an artist or an artistic style or work) begin to appeal to a different audience, especially a wider one.
examples: a talented animator who crossed over to live action

definitions.definition: pass in an opposite or different direction; intersect.
examples: the two lines cross at 90°
synonyms: crisscross "the point where the two roads cross"

definitions.definition: cause (two things) to intersect.
examples: cross the cables in opposing directions

definitions.definition: place (something) crosswise.
examples: Michele sat back and crossed her arms

definitions.definition: (of a letter) be sent before receipt of another from the person being written to.
examples: our letters crossed

definitions.definition: draw a line or lines across; mark with a cross.
examples: cross the t's

definitions.definition: mark or annotate (a check), typically by drawing a pair of parallel lines across it, to indicate that it must be paid into a named bank account.
delete a name or item on a list as being no longer required or involved.
examples: Liz crossed off the days on the calendar

definitions.definition: delete an incorrect or inapplicable word or phrase by drawing a line through it.
examples: delete, strike out, ink out, score out, edit out, cancel, obliterate looking at the manager's starting lineup, it seems that Mitchell's name has been crossed out

definitions.definition: (of a person) make the sign of the cross in front of one's chest as a sign of Christian reverence or to invoke divine protection.
pass (the ball) across the field toward the center when attacking.
cause (an animal of one species, breed, or variety) to interbreed with one of another species, breed, or variety.
examples: many animals of the breed were crossed with the closely related Guernsey

definitions.definition: cross-fertilize (a plant).
examples: a hybrid tea was crossed with a polyantha rose
synonyms: cross-pollinate "the breed was crossed with the similarly colored Holstein"

definitions.definition: oppose or stand in the way of (someone).
examples: no one dared cross him
synonyms: take issue with; formalgainsay "no one dared cross him"

definitions.definition: annoyed.
examples: he seemed to be very cross about something

definitions.definition: denoting movement or position across something.
examples: cross-channel

definitions.definition: denoting interaction.
examples: cross-pollinate

definitions.definition: passing from side to side; transverse.
examples: crosspiece

definitions.definition: describing the form or figure of a cross.
examples: crossbones
